definition: ostentation/a show of extravagance/grand style/red tape
a row/a line/to set in order/to arrange/to line up/to eliminate/to drain/to push open/platoon/raft/classifier for lines, rows etc
large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: It's big, but not as big as some wealthier people in China.
sentences.chinese: 在中國，還不如一些有錢人的排場。

sentences.english: Also, in China a wedding ceremony is largely a way for the couple`s parents to demonstrate their financial status.
sentences.chinese: 而且，在中國，對雙方父母而言，婚禮講的是排場。

sentences.english: TO MUCH fanfare, Italy celebrated 150 years since its unification two weeks ago.
sentences.chinese: 兩週前意大利很排場地慶祝了150週年統一紀念。

sentences.english: He likes to treat his date in a big way .
sentences.chinese: 他喜歡大排場地招待女友。

definition: manner/style/panache
lit. an easy drive on a familiar path (idiom); fig. experience makes progress easy/a task that is so familiar one can do it with one's hand tied behind one's back
taboo/to avoid as taboo/to abstain from
to praise without cease (idiom); praise sb to high heaven
to perform in opera
psychological drama
to act in a play/to put on a play
newly rich/parvenu/upstart
excellent in every respect/flawless
to work hard/to do one's very best/to throw oneself into the task at hand
daughter-in-law
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
lit. not a common chord (idiom); outstanding/brilliant/out of the common run
to make thoughtless remarks (idiom)/to criticize/gossip
to be a real headache/to find sth a real headache/to beat one's brains
folk art consisting of storytelling to music
